I can't agree more. Instead of emphasizing on the uniform interface,  
ofte=
n, there is this misleading focus on naming URIs. Whether a URI  
has "dele=
te" should not matter as long as the uniform interface is  
honored. Removi=
ng an operation name from a URI does not automatically  
make the URI opera=
ble through the uniform interface.

Subbu

> I don=92t know what =93putting=
 the semantics of the interface into
>
> the URI=94 even means, nor do I un=
derstand why allowing humans to
> interpret URIs is a bad idea.
>

 we posit that this is somehow a problem because they will

rite code against the URIs, well, their code will

UT to the proper resource=92s URI which has

ource, not an action; they would, as
